Selected Answer: D
D. Providing a bit-level image of the hard drive

A bit-level image (or forensic image) captures an exact, sector-by-sector copy of the entire hard drive, preserving all data, including deleted files, unallocated space, and system metadata. This method ensures the integrity of the evidence and allows for proper forensic analysis while maintaining the chain of custody, making it highly acceptable in legal proceedings. It is considered the most reliable method for evidence collection because it captures all aspects of the system in its state at the time of collection.
